revised_title: Molecular Techniques for Studying Microbial Pathogenicity: A Focus on Bordetella Pertussis
tldr: This article discusses the use of molecular techniques to study microbial determinants of pathogenicity, focusing on the bacterium Bordetella pertussis, which causes whooping cough. The authors describe their efforts to develop a genetic transfer system within Bordetella and identify specific genetic sequences encoding several determinants of pathogenicity. They also discuss the challenges of working with fastidious microorganisms and the importance of understanding the genetic basis of pathogenicity to develop safe and effective vaccines.
